1ï¸âƒ£ MCP Code Checker (Python)Â¶

OverviewÂ¶

MCP server providing code quality checks (pylint and pytest) with smart LLM-friendly prompts for analysis and fixes.

Correct InstallationÂ¶

Option A: From GitHub (Recommended)

# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/mcpflow/mcp_server_code_checker_python.git
cd mcp_server_code_checker_python

# Install with pip
pip install -e .

# Or install directly
pip install git+https://github.com/mcpflow/mcp_server_code_checker_python.git

Option B: Alternative Repository

git clone https://github.com/MarcusJellinghaus/mcp-code-checker.git
cd mcp-code-checker
pip install -e .

RunningÂ¶

python -m src.main --project-dir D:\Projects\main

FeaturesÂ¶

  • âœ… Run pylint checks for code quality

  • âœ… Execute pytest to identify failing tests

  • âœ… Generate smart prompts for LLMs

  • âœ… Explain issues and suggest fixes

RequirementsÂ¶

  • Python 3.10+

  • Python MCP SDK 1.2.0+

ConfigurationÂ¶

{
  "code-checker": {
    "type": "stdio",
    "command": "python",
    "args": ["-m", "src.main", "--project-dir", "D:\\Projects\\main"],
    "env": {},
    "description": "Code quality checks with pylint and pytest"
  }
}

2ï¸âƒ£ Python LFT MCP (Lint, Format, Test)Â¶

OverviewÂ¶

Modern, modular Python development tools package exposing linting, formatting, and testing capabilities via MCP.

Correct InstallationÂ¶

From PyPI:

# Basic installation
pip install python-lft-mcp

# With all optional tool dependencies (recommended)
pip install python-lft-mcp[tools]

FeaturesÂ¶

  • âœ… Auto-detection of 70+ Python config files

  • âœ… Integrated tools: ruff, black, pytest, mypy, pylint

  • âœ… Unified MCP interface

  • âœ… Tox for standardized workflows

Supported ToolsÂ¶

  • Linting: ruff, pylint

  • Formatting: black, ruff

  • Testing: pytest

  • Type Checking: mypy

  • Coverage: coverage reporting

ConfigurationÂ¶

{
  "python-lft": {
    "type": "stdio",
    "command": "python",
    "args": ["-m", "python_lft_mcp"],
    "env": {},
    "description": "Python lint, format, and test tools"
  }
}

3ï¸âƒ£ MCP Server Analyzer (RUFF + Vulture)Â¶

OverviewÂ¶

Comprehensive Python code analysis using RUFF for linting and VULTURE for dead code detection.

Correct InstallationÂ¶

Option A: uvx (Recommended)

uvx install mcp-server-analyzer

Option B: pip

pip install mcp-server-analyzer

Option C: From Source

git clone https://github.com/anselmoo/mcp-server-analyzer.git
cd mcp-server-analyzer
uv sync --dev
uv run mcp-server-analyzer

Option D: Docker

docker run ghcr.io/anselmoo/mcp-server-analyzer:latest

FeaturesÂ¶

  • ğŸ” RUFF Analysis: Comprehensive Python linting with auto-fixes

  • ğŸ§¹ Dead Code Detection: Find unused imports, functions, variables with VULTURE

Package InfoÂ¶

  • PyPI: mcp-server-analyzer v0.1.1

  • GitHub: https://github.com/anselmoo/mcp-server-analyzer

ConfigurationÂ¶

{
  "analyzer": {
    "type": "stdio",
    "command": "uvx",
    "args": ["mcp-server-analyzer"],
    "env": {},
    "description": "RUFF linting and VULTURE dead code detection"
  }
}

4ï¸âƒ£ NumPy MCP ServerÂ¶

OverviewÂ¶

Model Context Protocol server for numerical computations with NumPy.

Correct InstallationÂ¶

From GitHub:

# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/colesmcintosh/numpy-mcp.git
cd numpy-mcp

# Install with UV
uv venv
source .venv/bin/activate  # Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate
uv pip install -r requirements.txt

# Or install in Claude Desktop
mcp install server.py --name "NumPy Calculator"

FeaturesÂ¶

  • âœ… Basic arithmetic operations

  • âœ… Linear algebra (matrix multiplication, eigendecomposition)

  • âœ… Statistical analysis (mean, median, std dev)

  • âœ… Polynomial fitting

Testing with DependenciesÂ¶

uv run mcp dev server.py --with pandas --with numpy

ConfigurationÂ¶

{
  "numpy-mcp": {
    "type": "stdio",
    "command": "python",
    "args": ["D:\\Projects\\main\\.mcp_servers\\numpy-mcp\\server.py"],
    "env": {},
    "description": "NumPy numerical computations and linear algebra"
  }
}

5ï¸âƒ£ Pandas MCP ServerÂ¶

OverviewÂ¶

Multiple implementations available for pandas data analysis via MCP.

Correct InstallationÂ¶

Option A: marlonluo2018 implementation (Recommended)

git clone https://github.com/marlonluo2018/pandas-mcp-server.git
cd pandas-mcp-server
pip install -r requirements.txt

Option B: alistairwalsh implementation

# Available via PulseMCP
# Installation details from repository

FeaturesÂ¶

  • âœ… Execute pandas code through standardized workflow

  • âœ… Data manipulation and analysis

  • âœ… Statistical analysis

  • âœ… Data visualization with matplotlib

  • âœ… Support for CSV and Parquet files

Use CasesÂ¶

  • Automated data exploration

  • Dynamic RAG pipelines

  • Real-time sentiment analysis

  • Data-driven project analysis

ConfigurationÂ¶

{
  "pandas-mcp": {
    "type": "stdio",
    "command": "python",
    "args": ["D:\\Projects\\main\\.mcp_servers\\pandas-mcp-server\\server.py"],
    "env": {},
    "description": "Pandas data analysis and visualization"
  }
}

6ï¸âƒ£ Sphinx-MCP ExtensionÂ¶

OverviewÂ¶

Sphinx extension for documenting MCP tools, prompts, resources and resource templates.

Correct InstallationÂ¶

Option A: From PyPI (if available)

pip install sphinx-mcp

Option B: From GitHub (Development)

git clone https://github.com/sphinx-contrib/mcp.git
cd mcp
uv sync --all-groups

StatusÂ¶

  • â³ Early stage project (no tests yet)

  • ğŸ“„ Documentation: sphinx-mcp.pdf (pre-compiled)

  • ğŸ”§ Development setup with uv and pre-commit

FeaturesÂ¶

  • Document MCP tools

  • Document prompts

  • Document resources and resource templates

  • Sphinx integration for documentation generation

RequirementsÂ¶

  • uv for dependency management

  • pre-commit for Git hooks

VerificationÂ¶

# Check if already installed
pip list | grep sphinx-mcp
python -c "import sphinx_mcp; print(sphinx_mcp.__version__)"

ğŸ“¦ Installation PriorityÂ¶

High Priority (Production Ready)Â¶

  1. mcp-server-analyzer - RUFF + Vulture, ready to use

  2. python-lft-mcp - Available on PyPI, comprehensive tooling

Medium Priority (Active Development)Â¶

  1. mcp-code-checker - Stable GitHub repos, good for code quality

  2. numpy-mcp - Useful for numerical analysis in PSO/optimization

Lower Priority (Specialized Use Cases)Â¶

  1. pandas-mcp - Good for data analysis but overlaps with SQLite

  2. sphinx-mcp - Documentation only, early stage

ğŸ¯ Recommended Installation OrderÂ¶

  1. mcp-server-analyzer (uvx) - Easiest install, immediate value

  2. python-lft-mcp (PyPI) - One command install, broad utility

  3. mcp-code-checker (GitHub) - Clone and pip install

  4. numpy-mcp (GitHub) - For PSO numerical analysis

  5. pandas-mcp (GitHub) - If needed for advanced data analysis

  6. sphinx-mcp (verify existing) - Already attempted, check status

ğŸ”§ Local Server Directory StructureÂ¶

Create a dedicated directory for locally-installed MCP servers:

D:\Projects\main\.mcp_servers\
â”œâ”€â”€ mcp-code-checker\
â”œâ”€â”€ numpy-mcp\
â””â”€â”€ pandas-mcp-server\

This keeps GitHub-cloned servers organized and separate from npm global packages.

âœ… Next StepsÂ¶

  1. Install high-priority servers (analyzer, python-lft)

  2. Clone and setup GitHub-based servers (code-checker, numpy-mcp, pandas-mcp)

  3. Verify sphinx-mcp installation status

  4. Update .mcp.json with all new server configurations

  5. Test each server with MCP Inspector

  6. Create comprehensive testing workflow
